column4: hello, so i was messing around with some things in ubuntu after a fresh install, and completely messed up that partition. so i brought out my ubuntu cd to try and reinstall ubuntu, but when i boot up, the cd isn't the boot device. Now this is my issue: my keyboard does not work inside the bios. I can enter the bios perfectly fine by pressing the del key, but then once I'm inside the bios I cannot make any changes. I can't move
what kind of computer are you talking about?
It's a medion PC, probably around 4 years old
i believe to load the boot device screen you need to press F8 during boot.
